item.title: 2016 First Presidency’s Christmas Devotional
item.description: The 2016 First Presidency’s Christmas Devotional with music provided by the Mormon Tabernacle Choir and the Orchestra at Temple Square.

item.title: Elder Dallin H. Oaks
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks' address from the 2015 First Presidency's Christmas Devotional

item.title: Elder Craig C. Christensen
item.description: Elder Craig C. Christensen's address from the 2015 First Presidency's Christmas Devotional

item.title: Douglas D. Holmes
item.description: Brother Douglas D. Holmes' address from the 2015 First Presidency's Christmas Devotional

item.title: President Henry B. Eyring
item.description: President Henry B. Eyring's address from the 2015 First Presidency's Christmas Devotional

item.title: Because He Came
item.description: There is no better time than now, this very Christmas season, for all of us to rededicate ourselves to the principles taught by Jesus Christ.

item.title: The Gifts of Christmas
item.description: You can give a great and wonderful Christmas if you remember the gifts God has given you and, as best you can, offer them to others as He would.

item.title: Of Curtains, Contentment, and Christmas
item.description: If we are only willing to open our hearts and minds to the spirit of Christmas, we will recognize wonderful things happening around us that will direct or redirect our attention to the sublime.

item.title: The Gift of a Savior
item.description: Each act of kindness to anyone becomes a kindness to Him because He loves all of Heavenly Father’s children. And because that brings joy to Him, it also brings joy to His Father, to whom we owe thanks beyond measure.

item.title: Seeing Christmas through New Eyes
item.description: We celebrate the birth of the Son of God, the Creator, our Messiah. We rejoice that the King of kings came to earth, was born in a manger, and lived a perfect life.

item.title: “A Tree Is Life”: Planting Trees in Haiti for Future Generations
item.description: One Haitian man wanted to plant more trees, so he connected with the local congregation of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: The Perfect Lie | Tiffany Webster
item.description: When Tiffany Webster was 15 years old, someone asked what she hoped her life would look like in another 15 years. She saw perfection. But as checklists grew longer and expectations grew harder to meet, Tiffany felt exhausted and broken.

item.title: A Question That Put Life in Perspective | Stephen Jones
item.description: Stephen Jones has always had a passion for performing, but when it came to providing for his growing family, he wondered if it would be enough.

item.title: We Aren’t God’s Only People | Samuel Hislop
item.description: Years ago, Samuel Hislop moved to Eastern Ukraine. He discovered that the Ukrainian people, who came from cultural and religious backgrounds very different from his, had much to teach him as well.

item.title: Spiritual Beings and the Human Experience | Matt Townsend
item.description: Before Matt Townsend built his own successful relationship coaching practice, he was labeled “the jam bomber” and “loin boy” as a preteen. How do labels change our perceptions of ourselves? Who are we really?

item.title: Seeing Green | Jill Thomas
item.description: Jill Thomas lost her daughter Penny in a tragic accident. Though she had heard that the death of a loved one puts faith to the test, she was not prepared for the devastation she felt.

item.title: Eyes to See and Ears to Hear
item.description: As we keep the commandments we will have eyes to see and ears to hear and we will build the kingdom of God. Read Elder Clark's full conference talk here: https://www.lds.org/general-conference/2015/10/eyes-to-see-and-ears-to-hear.

item.title: Why Am I Here?
item.description: The funny thing about purpose is that you never know when you're going to find yours.

item.title: The Journey
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf recalls fleeing, as a child, from war-torn East Germany with his mother. Read his full conference address here.

item.title: Choose the Light
item.description: A reckless biker finds himself in a battle against time and the elements when he enters a situation he can’t get out of. He discovers his only option is to choose the light.

item.title: Special Witness - Elder Rasband
item.description: As modern pioneers, we are creating a heritage of faith for those who will follow us. How can I build upon the legacy of my ancestors? How can I be a modern pioneer? From Salt Lake City, Elder Rasband answers these questions.

item.title: Elder Dale G. Renlund
item.description: Temples endow individuals with power and seal families for eternity. How can we receive God’s greatest gift? How can we safely return back to Him? From Temple Square in Salt Lake City, Elder Dale G. Renlund answers those questions.

item.title: It Was a Miracle
item.description: A member of the Find a Better Job group talks about how faith, hard work, and learning to job search helped him get a great job and provide for his family.

item.title: How Jobs are Really Filled
item.description: An employer shares how job seekers should really be spending their time; networking.

item.title: Basketball Got Me a Job
item.description: Networking with friends using a Me in 30 Seconds statement helped this person find a job in the hidden job market.

category.title: Chapter 3: Match Your Skills to the Employer’s Needs
category.subtitle: Videos: 1

item.title: The 16th Time is the Charm
item.description: Taking the time to identify an employer’s needs and then change her application led to success for this job seeker.

item.title: The Power of Power Statements
item.description: Power statements are the best way to talk about your experience and accomplishments. This job seeker shares how they worked for him.

item.title: Better Written Materials
item.description: After experiencing some frustrating failures in her job search, this job seeker found success by improving her résumé and other written materials.

item.title: Amy Nails Her Interview
item.description: Amy shares how faith and preparation helped her have a successful interview.

item.title: Practice Interview Activity
item.description: A Find a Better Job group demonstrates how to do the practice interview activity.

item.title: Practice Makes Perfect
item.description: A successful job seeker shares how practicing for job interviews helped him.

item.title: Keep it Simple
item.description: An employer shares her perspective on what employees can do to be successful at work.

item.title: Growing
item.description: The skills it took to find your job are the same skills you will need to progress in your job.

item.title: Counseling About Our Money
item.description: A couple shares how the Personal Finances group gave them the tools and ability to counsel together, strengthen their marriage, and solve their financial problems.

item.title: From Debt to Obedience
item.description: Getting out of debt can be an act of faith. The Personal Finances group helped this person make progress to be debt free.

item.title: The Lord Knows
item.description: How personal finances went from overwhelming to hopeful, through to faith and effort.

item.title: Emergency Fund Miracle
item.description: A Personal Finances group member shares how developing an emergency fund led to miracles in her life.

item.title: There is More Than School
item.description: There are more training and education opportunities than you may realize. Heavenly Father understands your potential.

item.title: Going Back
item.description: An Education for Better Work participant shares how the group experience helped them finish their education and improve their employment.

item.title: Faith, Sacrifice, and School
item.description: A mother shares how she was guided to find ways to pay for her education, something she never thought was possible.

item.title: An Unexpected Family Business
item.description: A hobby becomes a small business and the source of a self-reliant income.

item.title: Maybe It’s Not For Me
item.description: Seeking guidance from the Lord, a group participant learns that employment, not a small business, was the best option for her.

item.title: Part-time Job to Full-time Business
item.description: An initial layoff becomes the opportunity to turn an occupation into a small business and greater self-reliance.

item.title: Growing My Business and My Testimony
item.description: Participating in a Starting and Growing My Business group led one group member to focus on their own worthiness as well as their business success.

item.title: Examining Questions with an Eternal Perspective
item.description: A young woman demonstrates the skill of reframing a difficult question in context of the Plan of Salvation.

item.title: Faith, Trust, and Pixie Dust
item.description: At the 2013 Military Devotional, Tanya Parke shares the story of her family when her husband was deployed.

item.title: The Wise Men Seek Jesus
item.description: The Wise Men present Jesus with gifts—gold, frankincense, and myrrh. After their visit, Mary and Joseph flee to Egypt to protect Jesus from the wicked King Herod, who wishes to kill the child.

item.title: The Christ Child is Presented at the Temple
item.description: Mary and Joseph take Jesus to the temple, where the righteous Simeon blesses the baby and rejoices that the Lord let him live to see this day.

item.title: Shepherds Learn of the Birth of Christ
item.description: The angel Gabriel announces the birth of Jesus to the shepherds. The shepherds then visit Mary, Joseph, and the newborn Jesus.

item.title: Mary and Joseph Travel to Bethlehem
item.description: Traveling to their ancestral city of Bethlehem, Mary and Joseph are unable to find a room in an inn. Instead, they find shelter in a place where animals are kept.

item.title: Mary and Elisabeth Rejoice Together
item.description: Mary visits her relative Elisabeth, who in her old age will also soon give birth to a miraculous child. The women rejoice together.

item.title: 2016 First Presidency’s Christmas Devotional
item.description: The 2016 First Presidency’s Christmas Devotional with music provided by the Mormon Tabernacle Choir and the Orchestra at Temple Square.

item.title: Elder Dallin H. Oaks
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks' address from the 2015 First Presidency's Christmas Devotional

item.description: Elder Craig C. Christensen's address from the 2015 First Presidency's Christmas Devotional

item.title: Because He Came
item.description: There is no better time than now, this very Christmas season, for all of us to rededicate ourselves to the principles taught by Jesus Christ.

item.title: The Gifts of Christmas
item.description: You can give a great and wonderful Christmas if you remember the gifts God has given you and, as best you can, offer them to others as He would.

item.title: Of Curtains, Contentment, and Christmas
item.description: If we are only willing to open our hearts and minds to the spirit of Christmas, we will recognize wonderful things happening around us that will direct or redirect our attention to the sublime.

item.title: The Gift of a Savior
item.description: Each act of kindness to anyone becomes a kindness to Him because He loves all of Heavenly Father’s children. And because that brings joy to Him, it also brings joy to His Father, to whom we owe thanks beyond measure.

item.title: Seeing Christmas through New Eyes
item.description: We celebrate the birth of the Son of God, the Creator, our Messiah. We rejoice that the King of kings came to earth, was born in a manger, and lived a perfect life.

item.title: Christmas Spirit
item.description: A young girl with true Christmas spirit quietly teaches her preoccupied family the true meaning of Christmas. President Thomas S. Monson, Prophet of the Lord Jesus Christ, shares his testimony of how to put Christ back into Christmas.

item.title: Kids and Christmas
item.description: Christmas is a time when we can all learn from a child's gratitude and love for Jesus Christ. See the meaning and the story of Christmas through the eyes of children.

category.title: Light the World: 25 Days of Service
category.subtitle: Videos: 25

item.title: LIGHTtheWORLD — Follow the example of Jesus Christ. Share His light —serve as He served.
item.description: This Christmas season, follow the example of Jesus Christ and #LIGHTtheWORLD. Visit Mormon.org for simple ideas to share His light through service during the month of December.

item.title: Dec 1: Jesus Lifted Others’ Burdens and So Can You
item.description: During this Christmastime we invite you to serve others as Jesus did, in 25 ways over 25 days. Dec 1: Jesus lifted other's burdens and so can you.

item.title: Dec 2: Jesus Honored His Parents and So Can You
item.description: During this Christmastime we invite you to serve others as Jesus did, in 25 ways over 25 days. Dec 2: Jesus honored His parents and so can you.

item.title: Dec 3: Jesus Helped Others to See and So Can You
item.description: During this Christmastime we invite you to serve others as Jesus did, in 25 ways over 25 days. Dec 3: Jesus helped others to see and so can you.

item.title: Dec 4: Jesus Worshipped His Father and So Can You
item.description: During this Christmastime we invite you to serve others as Jesus did, in 25 ways over 25 days. Dec 4: Jesus worshipped His father and so can you.

item.title: Dec 5: Jesus Healed the Sick and So Can You
item.description: During this Christmastime we invite you to serve others as Jesus did, in 25 ways over 25 days. Dec 5: Jesus healed the sick and so can you.

item.title: Dec 6: Jesus Read the Scriptures and So Can You
item.description: During this Christmastime we invite you to serve others as Jesus did, in 25 ways over 25 days. Dec 6: Jesus read the scriptures and so can you.

item.title: Dec 7: Jesus Fed the Hungry and So Can You
item.description: During this Christmastime we invite you to serve others as Jesus did, in 25 ways over 25 days. Dec 7: Jesus fed the hungry and so can you.

item.description: During this Christmastime we invite you to serve others as Jesus did, in 25 ways over 25 days. Dec 8: Jesus prayed for others and so can you.

item.title: Dec 9: Jesus Visited the Lonely and So Can you
item.description: During this Christmastime we invite you to serve others as Jesus did, in 25 ways over 25 days. Dec 9: Jesus visited the lonely and so can you.

item.title: Dec 10: Jesus Helped People Walk and So Can You
item.description: During this Christmastime we invite you to serve others as Jesus did, in 25 ways over 25 days. Dec 10: Jesus helped people walk and so can you.

item.title: Dec 12: Jesus Taught Others and So Can You

item.title: Dec 13: Jesus Showed Humility and So Can You
item.description: During this Christmastime we invite you to serve others as Jesus did, in 25 ways over 25 days. Dec 13: Jesus showed humility and so can you.

item.description: During this Christmastime we invite you to serve others as Jesus did, in 25 ways over 25 days. Dec 14: Jesus taught us to clothe the naked and so can you.

item.title: Dec 15: Jesus Worshipped through Song and So Can You
item.description: During this Christmastime we invite you to serve others as Jesus did, in 25 ways over 25 days. Dec 15: Jesus worshipped through song and so can you.

item.title: Dec 16: Jesus Showed Compassion and So Can You
item.description: During this Christmastime we invite you to serve others as Jesus did, in 25 ways over 25 days. Dec 16: Jesus showed compassion and so can you.
